sentences.en: An oar often acts as a rudder.
sentences.cn: 船桨常作舵来使用.

sentences.en: An oar often acts as rudder.
sentences.cn: 桨常可起舵的作用.

sentences.en: Another development of oars into sweeps was due to lengthening the oar handle.
sentences.cn: 桨的另一种演变途径是增长桨柄而成为梢。

sentences.en: Chueh - hsin and Ming - feng plied the oar vigorously.
sentences.cn: 觉新和鸣凤用力地划着船.

sentences.en: Cold worlds shake from the oar.
sentences.cn: 冰冷的世界从桨上摇落。

sentences.en: Except for the rhythmic splash of the rudder oar, all was still.
sentences.cn: 水面静静的,只有那有规律的荡桨声打破了静夜的沉寂.

sentences.en: He is prejudiced against you, and if you put in your oar, it will spoil everything.
sentences.cn: 他对你怀有偏见, 如果你插手的话, 会把一切都弄糟的.

sentences.en: He is the best oar in the crew.
sentences.cn: 他是水手中最佳划手.

sentences.en: He pulled as hard as he could on the oars.
sentences.cn: 他拼命地划桨。

sentences.en: He pulls a good oar.
sentences.cn: 他很会划船.

sentences.en: I know how to mend a fuse and I don't need you shoving your oar in!
sentences.cn: 我知道怎麽弄保险丝,用不着你管!

sentences.en: Kent must be kept out of this affair. He'll interfere and tries to have an oar in everyman's boat.
sentences.cn: 这事可不能让肯特参与. 他一定会横加干涉,乱管闲事.

sentences.en: Sometimes an oar is used to steer a boat.
sentences.cn: 有时桨用以操纵小舟.

sentences.en: Suchen never understood what had driven her to grasp the oar at the last moment.
sentences.cn: 苏晨从来没有想明白，是什么驱使她在最后一刻抓住了一条船桨。

sentences.en: The blade of the oar had entangled itself with something in the water.
sentences.cn: 船桨的桨叶和水里的什么东西缠住了。

sentences.en: The old man wiped the blade of his knife and laid down the oar.
sentences.cn: 老人擦了擦刀刃,把桨放下.

sentences.en: The roaring oar hit the coarse keyboard on the cupboard aboard the boat.
sentences.cn: 轰鸣的桨击中了船上碗柜上的粗糙键盘。

sentences.en: The sailors oar slowly across the river.
sentences.cn: 水手们慢慢地划过河去。

sentences.en: Then he took up the oar with the knife lashed to it.
sentences.cn: 然后他拿起上面绑着刀子的桨.

sentences.en: Watch out the oar doesn't pop you in the tummy.
sentences.cn: 当心桨，别撞在肚子上。

sentences.en: We were getting along fine until you stuck your oar in.
sentences.cn: 在你掺和进来之前，我们一直好好的。

trans.tran_en: a long pole with a wide flat blade at one end, used for rowing a boat
